7. Home Duties.--"The mother should be the teacher, and home the school where every child receives his first lessons; and these lessons should include habits of industry. . . . Let them also learn, even in their earliest years, to be useful. Train them to think that, as members of the household, they are to act an interested, helpful part 
                                                                           6
in sharing the domestic burdens, and to seek healthful exercise in the performance of necessary home duties.
